content.p: This is Quiz 5! Please answer the questions by selecting the option that best answers the question. You can justify your answers as well (a space is provided at the end of the quiz for all questions) We read these answers!!! Please read the question clearly. It is not expected that answers can be directly sourced from OLI. Some questions test your understanding and ability to apply a concept discussed on OLI. All the best.
Use this table with 8 observations to answer questions 1-3. Note that "Amount Requested" is in USD ($) and all three variables are predictor/independent variables.

body.p: Refer to the table and select the variable (s) that would benefit from the one-hot encoding technique:

input.choice: You would apply the technique to "Reason".
You would apply the technique to "Risk".
You would apply the technique to "Amount Requested".
You can apply the technique to "Risk"and "Amount Requested".

feedback.p: Correct: This variable presents the best option for this technique.
Incorrect: Risk is an ordered column and would benefit from the ordinal feature encoding technique.
Incorrect: You do not need to encode this column.
Incorrect: Both columns would not benefit from the one-hot encoding technique.

body.p: What encoding technique would you use for the variable named "Risk" and why:

input.choice: You would use the ordinal feature encoding technique because it is an ordered category.
You would use binary feature encoding technique because it would make training the model easier.
You would use one-hot encoding because you do not have a large number of levels.
You would use hash encoding to account for more levels that might be introduced with unseen data.

feedback.p: Correct: This category is ordered or ranked and would benefit from this technique.
Incorrect: There are more than two levels to this column and you would lose information by using this technique.
Incorrect: Since it is a column with ordered values. This technique would not work.
Incorrect: You should consider using one of the other encoding techniques.

body.p: Do you have differing answers to those listed above for questions 1-3? If yes, justify your answer here. If no or if your answer was scored correctly, write N/A
Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct:
I) You should use one hot encoding only when the category has a large number of levels.
II) You should use ordinal encoding when the ordered category has a few levels to the order.
III) You should use one-hot encoding when the category has no ordinal relationship.
IV) You should use ordinal encoding when there is an order or rank to the category needing encoding.

feedback.p: Incorrect: Both options are incorrect. You should use one-hot when you have less levels and there are no restrictions to the levels for ordinal encoding.
Incorrect: The reverse is the case for one-hot encoding.
Incorrect: This option does not take into account the flexibility of the encoding technique.
Correct: These assumptions are correct for both techniques.

body.p: Principal component analysis will show the linear relationship between two variables by calculating:

feedback.p: Correct: The covariance will show the relationship between the variables in a dataset and is calculated after the data is standardized.
Incorrect: The z-score is used to standardize data, an important step in performing PCA.
Incorrect: This is a scaling technique that will not show the relationship between the variables.
Incorrect:This is calculated in the first step of performing PCA to standardize data.

body.p: When the number of samples needed to estimate a function with a given level of accuracy grows exponentially with respect to the dimensionality of the function, this is known as:

feedback.p: Correct: Curse of dimensionality assumes that as the number of the features in a dataset increases, the amount of data that needs to be generalized also increases.
Incorrect: This technique is used to reduce the number of features in a dataset.
Incorrect: This technique is used to reduce the number of features when building a model.
Incorrect: Factor analysis is used to assess the relationship between variables.

body.p: Reference the image below, what variable should be encoded:

feedback.p: Correct: Food name should be encoded and new features should be created for Apple,Chicken and Broccoli.
Incorrect: Food name should be encoded but calories does not need to be encoded.
Incorrect: No new features should be created with calories. You can bin calories if there were more values and it made sense to do this.
Incorrect: Both do not need encoding, once you encode food name, categorical # will not be needed.

body.p: You would like to build a model that predicts the optimal home that a buyer would purchase, based on certain features including the age of the house (in months) and the number of bedrooms in the house. Will you need to perform feature engineering on the features mentioned in this task:

input.choice: Yes, you would need to scale the data points for age of the house and number of bedrooms.
Yes, you would need to perform one-hot encoding on the number of bedrooms.
No, all features seem to be scaled and will not present an issue.
No, performing feature engineering will result in the curse of dimensionality.

feedback.p: Correct: Both features need to be scaled.
Incorrect: Number of bedrooms is not a feature that needs label encoding.
Incorrect: If you do not scale the features, you risk outlier data as age of house in months and number of bedrooms are not of the same scale.
Incorrect: The curse of dimensionality is not applicable in this case as you need to perform feature engineering to ensure the data points will be received by the algorithm and model.

body.p: A study was conducted on the "program of study" preferences for women born and raised in Germany between 1989-1999. Previous data has shown that women typically prefer programs of study in the social sciences and humanities. The data from the current study showed that over 80% of the participants preferred to study a science or mathematics related major. If the data scientist is reluctant to fail to reject the null hypothesis because of the past studies and her knowledge of women enrolling in majors other than science and mathematics, this type of bias would be called:

feedback.p: Correct: Confirmation bias will occur when a data scientist interprets a scenario according to his or her prior beliefs. Essentially, this person can "twist" the data until it ceases to invalidate her opinion.

Incorrect:In this situation, selection bias would not be a suitable answer. Selection bias would occur in this case if the participants of the study were not representative of the population of women born within that time frame in Germany.
Incorrect: Information bias occurs when information is collected and interpreted wrongly.
Incorrect: Confounding bias occurs when there is a distortion of the association between two variables.

body.p: Which of the following statements is correct about principal component analysis:

input.choice: Principal component analysis cannot be performed on interrelated variables even when those variables are transformed.
The sum of the PCA eigenvalues is equal to the sum of the variances of the variables.
Principal component analysis is a supervised learning technique that can help reduce the number of features to avoid overfitting.
Principal component analysis (PCA) can be used with variables of any type without needing transformation.

feedback.p: Incorrect:PCA can be performed on such data, it would need to be transformed to variables that are orthogonal to each other.
Correct: This is a definition of PCA.
Incorrect: PCA is an unsupervised learning technique!

Incorrect: PCA should not be used on variables that are non-quantitative data types, unless it is transformed: even at that it is suggested that you do not. There are other techniques! How would you calculate covariance of a discrete variable?

body.p: The process of extracting features from raw data and transforming those features to fit the model is called:

feedback.p: Correct: This process leads to higher quality models.
Incorrect: This term does not apply to extracting and transforming features.
Incorrect: This is the process of exploring data visually or using summary statistics.
Incorrect: Although you are performing data understanding tasks, data understanding encompasses data wrangling, exploration and preparation.

body.p: Your justifications are read and considered each week, please use this space to include text about the quiz questions.
